definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
(conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: Ms. priority is a well-known code of conduct.
sentences.chinese: 女士优先是一个人人皆知的行为准则。

sentences.english: Everyone should abide by our social norms.
sentences.chinese: 我们每个人都应该遵守社会行为准则。

sentences.english: Some suppliers will already adhere to the standards set out in the Coles Myer Ethical Sourcing Code.
sentences.chinese: 一些供应商将会符合高斯美雅的道德行为准则。

sentences.english: "Our movement and our leadership, Abdul Wahid al Nur, are not involved in this hijacking of the plane. This is against our principles and our behavior," he said.
sentences.chinese: 这是违反我们的原则和行为准则的。

sentences.english: I have not been true to my values and the behavior my family deserves.
sentences.chinese: 我未能忠于我的价值观和行为准则，对不起我的家人。

sentences.english: Their work ethic determines how well they will do in the future.
sentences.chinese: 他们学习的行为准则决定了他们将来能够干得多好。

sentences.english: This language will serve as the bridge for connecting codes of conduct into the development process.
sentences.chinese: 这一语言将作为连接行为准则与开发过程的桥梁。

sentences.english: You can't afford to ignore the profe ion's code of conduct.
sentences.chinese: 你不能无视行业的行为准则。

definition: words and actions/what one says and what one does
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)

precepts regarding what is honorable and what is shameful (in particular, refers to the Socialist Concepts on Honors and Disgraces, PRC official moral principles promulgated from 2006)/abbr. for 社會主義榮辱觀|社会主义荣辱观/also known as the Eight Honors and Eight Shames 八榮八恥|八荣八耻[Ba1 Rong2 Ba1 Chi3]
